translations.translation: Let him call his attendants;
So let him call his associates,
So let him summon his helpmates;
Let him call on his associates for help
So let him now call his gang!
Then let him call upon his council.
Then let him summon his council,
So let him call on his concourse!
Then let him call upon his henchmen!
Then let him call his associates;
Then, let him call his assembly,
Then let him call out his gang!
Then, let him call (for help) to his council (of comrades):
Then, let him call upon his council (of helpers),
So, let him call upon his way!
Let him call on his gang.
Then let him call his associates;

[96:17] Let him, then, call upon [the henchmen of] his council, the members of his council (nādin) — a place of assembly where people gather to talk. He [Abū Jahl] had said to the Prophet (s) in reproof, having forbidden him from prayer, ‘You are well aware that there is none in this [town] who has [recourse to] as large a council [of men] as I do. Verily, I shall fill this [entire] valley with mature steeds and young men [in battle] against you if you so wish!’
(Then let him call upon his henchmen) his folk and companions!

commentaries.author: زيد بن علي
commentaries.text: وقوله تعالى: { فَلْيَدْعُ نَادِيَهُ } معناه أهلُ مَجلسهِ

translations.translation: And his saying, "Let him call upon his council" [Qur'an 6:130], its meaning is the people of his assembly.
